alert.note: Alert for Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 16 at 11:48PM EST until February 18 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Jackson KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kentucky... Cumberland River at Williamsburg affecting Whitley County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cumberland River at Williamsburg. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon to late Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Flooding threatens low lying roads and structures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 PM EST Thursday the stage was 9.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage early Friday afternoon, reaching 21.8 feet by tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning, and to 19.0 feet early Sunday morning. It will rise to 19.3 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.8 feet on 03/22/1974. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. The next statement will be issued by 8 AM EST Friday.
